sentence.Network_en: Don't get cocky when you've achieved something.
He was a little bit cocky when he was about 11 because he was winning everything.
sentence.Network_cn: 11岁左右的时候，他就有点自以为是，因为他那时从未失败过。

sentence.Network_en: It's rather difficult for a cocky person to be on good terms with others.
sentence.Network_cn: 一个傲慢的人要和别人很好地相处,那是很难的.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (in the sense 'lecherous'): from cock + -y

encyclopedia.content: 注释 cocky adj. 形容词 骄傲的， 自大的， 过于自信的 音标：['kɔki] （英） ['kɑkɪ] （美）词形变化 cockier, cockiest 由来 近些年来在美国盛行的口语，没有确凿的由来，完全是俗语，不用于书面语言，常常用描写男人很自鸣得意。常用例句 I can't stand that guy and his cock attitude. ("cocky attitude" 是常用的词语） Did you see the interview with Charlie Sheen? 锛埐槔怼ば溜級 What a

entry.tran: 骄傲自大的;自以为是的
entry.def: Someone who is cocky is so confident and sure of their abilities that they annoy other people.

example.ex: He was a little bit cocky when he was about 11 because he was winning everything.
example.tran: 11岁左右的时候，他就有点自以为是，因为他那时从未失败过。

auth_sentence.content: I was cocky and had too much too soon.
auth_sentence.res_content: I was cocky and had too much too soon.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I was cocky and had too much too soon.

auth_sentence.content: But Republicans should not get cocky when they win.
auth_sentence.res_content: But Republicans should not get cocky when they win.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But Republicans should not get cocky when they win.

auth_sentence.content: Feeling cocky now, I decided to take the stairs.
auth_sentence.res_content: Feeling cocky now, I decided to take the stairs.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Feeling cocky now, I decided to take the stairs.
